text:
Does anything similar apply to JS for this note:
```Please Note If you're using jQuery to manipulate the values of form inputs (i.e. using val() or prop()), you must trigger a change event using change() or trigger('change') for the change to properly register.```
?
I'm able to change the a checkbox in a series of checkboxes to checked, but when I selected a different one the first one unchecks
it looks like whatever HubSpot runs when clicking a checkbox loops through and causes my checkbox to be unchecked
I'm bad at reading docs or it's a secret (or general knowledge maybe)...it works if you click() but not if you set to true

so I'm getting a super fun one-off quirk occurring at `line 9130` of the HubSpot form required `v2.js` that is resetting a value on any random click on the browser window. Would anyone by completely random chance happen to have had issues with the `v2.js` file clearing values in their dev history?
<@UDHT6N5SM>.... is this a new issue you are seeing?
maybe but I really don't know, it depends on if updating a checkbox by just setting `element.checked = true` is allowed or if HubSpot requires a click on purpose.
Hm. Don't think our issues are related
Hahaha.. I'm totally writing in the wrong channel
